result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph B Delatorre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.
Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph B Delatorre

Defendant Joseph B Delatorre in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
  Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 30, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  Must attend 3 self-help meetings per week and provide written proof of attendance to ZCI.

Defendant Joseph B Delatorre in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.
  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
BTC:  Vacate warrant.
  ***DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY***
